segments_before_alignment.text: Hey there, knowledge junkies! Strap in for some mind-bending facts that'll blow your socks off. Ever wonder where all the teaspoons disappear to? Scientists actually studied this! In 2004, Australian researchers investigated the Great Workplace Teaspoon Banishing Act.

History-making moment. Ralph Bunche smashed barriers as the first black person to win the Nobel Peace Prize. His 1950 mediation work between Arabs and Israelis? Absolutely legendary. Talk about military dedication. Spartan men couldn't live with their families until age 30. That's right, decades of military service before any family time.

Get this, the US literally declared war on the Mormon church. 1857 was wild when the feds said absolutely not to Utah's religious laws. Church versus state showdown. Job hunting tip that'll change your life? A whopping 80% of US jobs are never even advertised. It's all about who you know, not what you apply for. This will shock you. In 2015 alone, nine people died every day just commuting on Mumbai's local trains. Makes your traffic jam seem pretty tame, huh?

Trees are basically the ultimate nappers. Science proves they sleep at night, chilling out their branches after dark and perking up before sunrise. Your sunscreen is lying to you. SPF is totaling on linear. SPF 15 blocks 93%, SPF 30 blocks 97%, and SPF 50, just 98%. That higher number isn't as magical as you think. Texas has some interesting priorities. It's actually illegal to own 6 or more dildos there. 5? You're good. 6? You're a criminal.
Your brain is a dictionary. By age 20, the average English-speaking American knows a staggering 42,000 dictionary words. No wonder you're so impressively articulate.
